head.title: An old song ended
head.firstline: How should I your true love know

poem.body:
“How should I your true love know From another one?” “By his cockle-hat and staff And his sandal-shoon.”
“And what signs have told you now That he hastens home?” “Lo! the spring is nearly gone, He is nearly come.”
“For a token is there nought, Say, that he should bring?” “He will bear a ring I gave And another ring.”
“How may I, when he shall ask, Tell him who lies there?” “Nay, but leave my face unveiled And unbound my hair.”
“Can you say to me some word I shall say to him?” “Say I'm looking in his eyes Though my eyes are dim.”
